behavior.name: human-gate
behavior.summary: Defines what a human gate is and how to present information for human approval.
behavior.definition: A HUMAN_GATE is a hard block. The orchestrator MUST stop and wait for explicit human approval before proceeding. No assumptions. No skipping. The human's decision is final — approve, reject with feedback, or abort.

section.name: protocol
section.rule: Present the gate summary to the human.
Clearly state: "BLOCKED — waiting for your approval to proceed."
Wait for human response. Do not take any action until they respond.

On APPROVE: proceed with the work that was pending approval. On REJECT: pass feedback to the relevant agents and loop back to revise. On ABORT: stop entirely, report status, and preserve all work done so far.
